abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Power Project for
            Guinea was unsatisfactory. The project achieved some of its
            objectives, its impact on institutional development was
            negligible, sustainability is unlikely, and the performance
            of both the Bank and Borrower was less than satisfactory.
            The main lesson that can be learned from this project is
            that it was not possible for the Bank to rehabilitate such a
            sector or major public enterprise when the rest of the
            economy was not functioning. Also, it was unrealistic for
            the appraisal team to have expected to redress the
            institutional set-up of the sector and the personnel issues
            (motivation, compensation, etc.) of SNE in isolation of
            improvements in the overall Government policy towards public enterprises.
